intro: [WRONG START] Crumina crupinastrum proles visianus, commonly known as the Visianus crupina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, bushy growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
